content:
IAccIdentity Interface

Definition

The IAccIdentity and all of its exposed members are part of a managed wrapper for the Component Object Model (COM) IAccIdentity interface.

In this Article

[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComConversionLoss]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.Guid("7852B78D-1CFD-41C1-A615-9C0C85960B5F")]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.InterfaceType(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComInterfaceType.InterfaceIsIUnknown)]
public interface IAccIdentity

Remarks

For more information about IAccIdentity, see the documentation for IAccIdentity::GetIdentityString in the Microsoft Active Accessibility documentation in the MSDN library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.

Methods

GetIdentityString(UInt32,IntPtr,UInt32)

The IAccIdentity and all of its exposed members are part of a managed wrapper for the Component Object Model (COM) IAccIndentity interface.

public void GetIdentityString (uint dwIDChild, IntPtr ppIDString, out uint pdwIDStringLen);
dwIDChild
UInt32

Specifies which child of the IAccessible object the caller wants to identify.

ppIDString
IntPtr

Address of a variable that receives a pointer to a callee-allocated identity string. The callee allocates the identity string using CoTaskMemAlloc; the caller must release the identity string by using CoTaskMemFree when finished.

pdwIDStringLen
UInt32

Address of a variable that receives the length, in bytes, of the callee-allocated identity string.

Remarks

For more information about GetIdentityString, see the documentation for IAccIdentity::GetIdentityString in the Microsoft Active Accessibility documentation in the MSDN library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.
